interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Amanda
Review Date: 2014/10/22
Store: Randy Ryan  (Actor),     Steve Marra  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
Product Description: ["Joe is a 40-year-old womanizer until he meets Amanda. It's love at first sight and a match made in heaven. They enjoy a storybook romance and decide to get married, much to the dismay of Joe's quirky but loving parents. It's marital bliss until Joe discovers that Amanda was born a man and had a sex change at age 18! Devastated by Amanda's shocking admission, Joe sends her out the door. After much thought, however, Joe comes to his senses and realizes that Amanda was the best thing that ever happened to him. In his quest to find Amanda and rekindle their relationship, he discovers the real truth about love. This charming romantic comedy features Randy Ryan (Public Enemies) and Ariana Dubynin (The List) in a film that identifies true love and explores gender identity."]
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance', 'Format': 'NTSC, Dolby', 'Contributor': 'Steve Marra, Randy Ryan', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 25 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.5 Ounces', 'Director': 'Steve Marra', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Dolby', 'Run time': '1 hour and 25 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 13, 2015', 'Actors': 'Randy Ryan', 'Studio': 'osiris Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I like the movie because there aren't that many transgender-themed movies, and for the twist at the end. It had humorous moments, and raunchy references, but not a competitor for mainstream-LGBT hybrid comedy-romances (see Kissing Jessica Stein [[ASIN: B000QUCQXS]], Puccini for Beginners [[ASIN: B000N2H8XC]], Gray Matters [[ASIN: B000O76ZO4]], and Out At The Wedding [[ASIN: B001MVWMIY]] for spectacular examples).
Review Title: Okay, but I want more on this theme.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Umbrellas of Cherbourg [Korean Import] Catherine deneuve (Actor), Nino Castelnuovo (Actor), Jacques Demy (Director) & 0 more Format: DVD Movies & TV, Movies {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jacques Demy', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Actors': 'Catherine deneuve, Nino Castelnuovo', 'Subtitles': 'English, Korean', 'Language': 'Unqualified (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)'} Get the British/European disc with the colored stripes on the cover, not the Korean one which is fullscreen and of bootleggy quality. The Special Edition is widescreen and of good quality like 'The Girls of Rochefort' also available on Amazon. Get Special Edition, not Korean disc. The Car James Brolin (Actor), Elliot Silverstein (Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Horror ['Fasten your seatbelts for the terrifying thrill ride that has become a cult classic - The Car! The peaceful tranquility of a small Western town is disturbed when a murderous car wreaks havoc by viciously mowing down innocent victims. New sheriff, Wade Parent (James Brolin), may be the only one who can stop this menace in its tracks until he realizes that the driver of this indestructible vehicle is far more dangerous than any man… it is driven by pure evil. With a digitally remastered picture, The Car has never been more thrilling, more chilling or more explosively entertaining!Bonus Content:', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer'] {'Genre': 'Horror, Suspense, Arthouse', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'James Brolin, Elliot Silverstein', 'Initial release date': '2008-05-06', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1103503', 'Director': 'Elliot Silverstein', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2008', 'Actors': 'James Brolin', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} This is a review about this version of the disc, not the movie. This 'new' disc sold by Amazon, with no DVD security features on the packaging, has numerous glitches; I suspect it's on all copies of this edition, I bought it new. It pauses momentarily, perhaps makes a sound, and continues. It's done this several times already having started the movie (it's on as I speak). It's widescreen and the picture quality is okay, but my roommate pointed out to me that it's overdubbed, that is the sound isn't always matching the lips; I checked the listing, and sure enough, it says "dubbed". I haven't tried the French-language soundtrack. I already purchased a used copy of a more expensive edition of this film by Anchor Bay. I'll be returning this one. I'm surprised at Amazon for selling an inferior version as new.

--

I received and am playing the disk I referred to [[ASIN:6305511861 The Car]] and when trying to review the Amazon system informed me I have already reviewed the product, being the other disk of inferior condition that wouldn't play. This, of course, is ridiculous. This disk, as I have anticipated, is superior and is playing without a single glitch. It was professionally produced with packaging as a DVD should be. So, definitely get this (ASIN 6305511861) rather than the cheaper disk on Amazon which began this review. Both are Region 1. I bought a used disk which is in better condition than the "new" one sold by Amazon. Neither Region 1 DVD disk of this movie has subtitles. I'm happy with the widescreen version included on the ASIN mentioned. The single caveat of this edition is that the packaging has a definite flaw: the ring that holds the disk continues in a full circle even past the finger indentations, making it impossible to remove the disk easily even when holding down the middle button. You could scratch the disk trying to get it out, I had to hold it upside down and dig with the "button finger". I won't return it to the case. But the disk itself is great, and the one I recommend (Anchor Bay). Too bad it's out of print. Glitched. Dubbed. New?? profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preference:** The user has a strong inclination towards classic and international cinema, particularly favoring cult classics. Recently, they have shown an interest in LGBTQ+ themes, reflected in their engagement with transgender-themed films.
- **Quality Consciousness:** They prioritize high-quality versions of media products, consistently opting for well-reviewed editions and discussing the ranking of LGBTQ+ films in relation to mainstream comedy romances.
- **Support for Subtitles:** Open to foreign language films with subtitles, indicating a desire for diverse cinematic experiences that extend beyond mainstream offerings.
- **Attention to Packaging and Presentation:** Values aesthetically pleasing and functional packaging, continuing to emphasize the importance of professional presentation in media formats.
- **Strong Recommendations:** Willing to share insights and contrasts based on personal experiences, demonstrating a knowledgeable stance in film selections, particularly between different editions and genres.
- **Critical Evaluation:** Maintains a keen eye for detail and provides critical feedback on media products, especially regarding audio quality and overall presentation. They express frustration with inferior products and continue to prefer reliable sellers.

Overall, the user demonstrates sophisticated taste in films, favoring high-quality, well-presented versions while being critical of subpar offerings in the market, and is increasingly exploring diverse narratives in cinema.
